snippet: Also, big changes at all three evening newscasts, new Oscar documentary rules, a thaw between Keith Olbermann and Current TV and behind of the scenes of a Hollywood struggle.
abstract: Also, big changes at all three evening newscasts, new Oscar documentary rules, a thaw between Keith Olbermann and Current TV and behind of the scenes of a Hollywood struggle.
lead_paragraph: Suze Orman, the CNBC financial adviser, has introduced a prepaid debit card, investing more $1 million of her own money in the project. These kinds of cards - which are meant for people with no credit history, or poor credit history - have drawn criticism for sky-high fees and poor disclosure. Ms. Orman says she wants to broaden the debit card market by charging low fees and offering new services, Ron Lieber writes; he adds that the project "raises so many questions that it is hard to even know where to start."

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Suze Orman's Debit Card and a New CBS Morning Show
